it.polimi.se2019.limperio.nicotera.italia.controller

Class ShootController

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.limperio.nicotera.italia.controller.ShootController

  • public class ShootController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller that checks the correct development of the shoot action. It strictly collaborates with the weapon controller to know what a weapon can do and what requests to the player to help during the action.
    Author:
    Pietro L'Imperio.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean alreadyAskedToUseTargeting
      It's true if it has already asked to the player attacker if he wants to use targeting scope, false otherwise.
      private ColorOfCard_Ammo ammoForPayTargeting
      Ammo chosen by the player to pay the effect of targeting scope.
      private java.util.ArrayList<ColorOfCard_Ammo> colorsNotEnough
      Array list of color of ammo that contains colors of ammo not enough to complete the payment.
      private Controller controller
      Reference of the controller.
      private boolean doesntWantToContinueToShoot
      It's true if the player has decided to finish the shoot action, false otherwise.
      private Game game
      Reference of the game.
      private java.util.ArrayList<InvolvedPlayer> involvedPlayers
      Array list of player involved to collect every player and square with the relative effect where they are involved to.
      private boolean isForTerminator
      It's true if the method handleRequestAfterShoot is called after the shoot action of terminator, false otherwise.
      private boolean needToChooseAPlayer
      It's true if after the choose of a player or of a square the player attacker has to choose another player.
      private boolean needToChooseASquare
      It's true if after the choose of a player or of a square the player attacker has to choose another square.
      private boolean needToStoreOriginalSquare
      It's true if there is the need to store the original square of the target for the next effects, false otherwise.
      private Square originalSquareOfTheTarget
      The reference of the original square of the target chosen by the player attacker.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Player> playersAreChoosingForTagback
      Array list of players that are choosing if use tagback against player attacker or not.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Player> playersAttacked
      Array list of all the players attacked during the shoot action.
      private java.util.ArrayList<PowerUpCard> powerUpCardToDiscardToPay
      Array list of power up that player chosen to pay an effect when he has not enough ammo.
      private ColorOfCard_Ammo[] priceToPay
      Price to pay to the current effect.
      private PowerUpCard targetingScopeToUse
      Reference of the power up card targeting scope that the player decides to discard to use its effect.
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> typeOfAttack
      Array list of the number that represents effects chosen during shoot action.
      private WeaponCard weaponToUse
      Weapon card chosen by the player to do the shoot action.

      • ShootController

    • Method Detail

      • replyToRequestToShoot

        void replyToRequestToShoot(ClientEvent message)
        Handles the request to shoot by the player. Initializes all of the fields useful for the correct development of the shoot action. Sends the request to choose a square if the player can move himself before to shoot or calls the methods that sends an event with all of the weapon usable.
        Parameters:
        message - Event received by client with the request to shoot.

      • sendRequestToChooseAWeapon

        void sendRequestToChooseAWeapon(Player player)
        Sends the request to choose a weapon to the player that decided to shoot checking for each weapon if is usable to enable the relative button on the GUI.
        Parameters:
        player - Player that requested to shoot.

      • findWeaponCardWithThisName

        private WeaponCard findWeaponCardWithThisName(java.lang.String name,
                                              Player player)
        Gets the weapon card with the name passed by parameter in the weapons deck of the player passed by parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the weapon card to find.
        player - Player owner of the weapons deck where look for the weapon.
        Returns:
        Weapon card of the player passed by parameter with the name passed by parameter.

      • replyWithUsableEffectsOfThisWeapon

        void replyWithUsableEffectsOfThisWeapon(java.lang.String nameOfWeaponCard,
                                        Player player)
        Replies to the reqeust to choose a weapon by the player sending him the list of the effects usable of the weapon. To do this calls the right method in the weapon controller. It handles also the sending of the list of effects after has done another one specifying if the player can refuse finishing the action or not.
        Parameters:
        nameOfWeaponCard - Name of weapon card chosen by the player to shoot.
        player - The player owner of the card that decided to shoot.

      • handleRequestToUseEffect

        void handleRequestToUseEffect(RequestToUseEffect message)
        Handles the request to use an effect by the player. Handles this request with a switch statement where for each weapon calls the right method to complete correctly the effect.
        Parameters:
        message - Event received by the client with the number of the effect chosen by him.

      • sendRequestToChooseSquare

        private void sendRequestToChooseSquare(java.util.ArrayList<Square> squaresReachableWithThisMovements)
        Sends a request to choose a square to the player setting on the event the list of selectable squares.
        Parameters:
        squaresReachableWithThisMovements - List of selectable squares by the player.

      • setSquareInInvolvedPlayers

        void setSquareInInvolvedPlayers(SelectionSquare message)
        Sets the square chosen by the player in the list of players involved. After done this, checks if the player has to choose another square, or a player sending, in the case the request to choose them.
        Parameters:
        message - Event received by the client with the row and column of the square chosen by the player.

      • sendRequestToChoosePlayer

        private void sendRequestToChoosePlayer(int numOfMaxPlayerToChoose,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<Player> listOfPlayersChoosable,
                                       boolean canRefuse)
        Sends to the player the request to choose a player.
        Parameters:
        numOfMaxPlayerToChoose - Maximum number of the players that the owner of the card can choose.
        listOfPlayersChoosable - The list of the players that player can choose.
        canRefuse - It's true if the attacker player can refuse to choose another player, false otherwise.

      • getPlayersInvolvedInAnEffect

        private java.util.ArrayList<Player> getPlayersInvolvedInAnEffect(int effect)
        Gets the list of players involved in the effect passed by parameter.
        Parameters:
        effect - The effect of which is interested to know the player involved on it.
        Returns:
        Array list of players involved in the effect passed by parameter.

      • setPlayersInInvolvedPlayers

        void setPlayersInInvolvedPlayers(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
        Sets the player or the players chosen by the attacker in involved players with the current effect and in players attacked. Checks with the boolean needToStoreOriginalSquare if has to store the square of the player chosen. Checks with the boolean needToChooseASquare if has to send the request to select a square creating for each weapon that expects it the correct list of selectable squares. Checks with the boolean needToChooseAPlayer if has to send the request to select a player creating for each weapon that expects it the correct list of players. If the effect needs a payment, calls the method that handles the payment else calls the shoot of player and then ask to the player to choose another effect if he can or calls the handleRequestAfterShoot.
        Parameters:
        players - List of players chosen by the player. It can contain even only one player.

      • removePlayersForShockwave

        private void removePlayersForShockwave(java.util.ArrayList<Player> playersChoosable)
        Remove from a list of players passed by parameter the players that cannot be attacked by Shockwave.
        Parameters:
        playersChoosable - List of players from where remove the players that Shockwave cannot attack.

      • sendMapEvent

        private void sendMapEvent()
        Sends the map event after the use of an effect that move the owner of the weapon.

      • sendPlayerBoardEvent

        private void sendPlayerBoardEvent()
        Sends the player board event at the end of an attack to notify to all the players the new situation of the player boards of the players attacked.

      • handlePaymentForEffect

        private void handlePaymentForEffect(Player player,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<Player> playersAttacked)
        Handles the payment of an effect going to check if the effect is affordable only with ammo or with power up cards. If the effect is not affordable completely with ammo and the player has more than one power up card of the color needed to pay the effect sends a request to choose the power up to discard as ammo.
        Parameters:
        player - Owner of the card.
        playersAttacked - List of players attacked.

      • sendRequestToDiscardPowerUpCard

        private void sendRequestToDiscardPowerUpCard(Player player,
                                             java.util.ArrayList<ColorOfCard_Ammo> colorsNotEnough)
        Sends the request to discard power up card to pay an effect.
        Parameters:
        player - Owner of the class.
        colorsNotEnough - Colors of ammo that are not enough to pay the effect.

      • handleDiscardPowerUpToPayAnEffect

        void handleDiscardPowerUpToPayAnEffect(ClientEvent message)
        Handle the discard of the power up card to pay an effect.
        Parameters:
        message - Event received by the client with the name and color of the power up card to discard.

      • getInvolvedPlayersForThisEffect

        private java.util.ArrayList<InvolvedPlayer> getInvolvedPlayersForThisEffect(int effect)
        Gets the list of involved players in the effect specified as parameter.
        Parameters:
        effect - The effect of the weapon in which is interested know who is involved.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of involved players involved in the effect passed by parameter.

      • handleSendRequestAfterShoot

        void handleSendRequestAfterShoot(Player player,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<Player> playersAttacked,
                                 boolean isForTerminator)
        Handles the request after shoot calling the methods that sends the usable effect of the weapon if there is at least one and player has not already decided to interrupt the action. Sends the request to use targeting if the owner of weapon has at least one. Creates the list of players attacked and that can use tagback and sends to them the request to use it. At the end calls the method of the controller that handles the end of the action.
        Parameters:
        player - Owner of the weapon.
        playersAttacked - List of attacked players.
        isForTerminator - It's true if the method is called after the shoot of terminator, false otherwise.

      • couldUseTagback

        private boolean couldUseTagback(Player playerAttacked)
        Check if a player could use tagback.
        Parameters:
        playerAttacked - Player attacked by the owner of the weapon card during the action.
        Returns:
        True if playerAttacked could use tagback, false otherwise.

      • sendRequestToUseTargeting

        private void sendRequestToUseTargeting(Player player)
        Sends to the player owner of the weapon card the request to use a targeting scope.
        Parameters:
        player - Owner of the weapon.

      • handleDiscardPowerUpToUseTargeting

        void handleDiscardPowerUpToUseTargeting(DiscardPowerUpCard message)
        Handles the request to use targeting scope sending, if the player has decided to use it, the request to choose ammo or power up card to discard to pay the effect.
        Parameters:
        message - Event received by the client with name and color of the targeting he decided to discard to use.

      • handlePaymentForTargeting

        void handlePaymentForTargeting(DiscardAmmoOrPowerUpToPayTargeting message)
        Handles the payment of targeting scope.
        Parameters:
        message - Event received by the client with the information about what he decided to discard (ammo or power up card) to pay the effect of targeting.

      • handleUseOfTargeting

        void handleUseOfTargeting(ChoosePlayer message)
        Handles the use of targeting after that the player has paid for its effect.
        Parameters:
        message - Event received by the client with the player on who use the effect.

      • sendPlayerBoardEventAfterTargetingOrTagback

        void sendPlayerBoardEventAfterTargetingOrTagback(Player playerAttacker,
                                                 Player playerAttacked,
                                                 boolean isAfterTargeting)
        Sends the player board event after the use of targeting by the attacker or the tagback by some attacked players.
        Parameters:
        playerAttacker - Owner of the class.
        playerAttacked - Player attacked by playerAttacker and that has decided to use tagback against him.
        isAfterTargeting - It's true if is called after the use of targeting, false otherwise.

      • sendRequestToUseTagbackGranade

        private void sendRequestToUseTagbackGranade(java.util.ArrayList<Player> playersCouldUseTagback)
        Sends the request to the attacked players that could use tagback to use the power up card.
        Parameters:
        playersCouldUseTagback - List of player that could use tagback against the owner of the card.

      • handleRequestToUseTagbackGranade

        void handleRequestToUseTagbackGranade(DiscardPowerUpCard message)
        Handles the request to use tagback by a player attacked during the shoot action distinguishing the case where the player has decided to use the tagback from the other one.
        Parameters:
        message - Event received by the player with the name and color of tagback if he decided to use it.

      • getSquaresFromWherePlayerCanAttack

        private java.util.ArrayList<Square> getSquaresFromWherePlayerCanAttack(Player player,
                                                                       int movement)
        Gets the square from where player can attack because has at least one usable weapon. It is called when the player could choose to move before to shoot.
        Parameters:
        player - Owner of the weapon.
        movement - Movement that the player could do before to shoot.
        Returns:
        Array list of squares from where the player can shoot.

      • getSquareWhereThisWeaponIsUsable

        private java.util.ArrayList<Square> getSquareWhereThisWeaponIsUsable(WeaponCard weaponCard,
                                                                     int movement)
        Gets the list of square from where the weapon card passed by parameter can shoot.
        Parameters:
        weaponCard - Weapon card involved in the control.
        movement - Movement that the player owner of the card could do before to decide to shoot.
        Returns:
        Array list of squares where the weapon passed by parameter can be used.

      • handleMovementBeforeShoot

        void handleMovementBeforeShoot(SelectionSquare message)
        Handles the movement before to shoot by the player that can move becuase is over six damage or in frenzy mode.
        Parameters:
        message - Event received by the client with the row and column of the square that player decides to move before to shoot.
